title: Pride of Britain: Megan McKenna, Louis Walsh and Martin Bashir arrive
text:
She successfully made it through to week two of the X Factor: Celebrity live shows on Saturday.

And Megan McKenna was clearly in the mood for celebrating as she joined mentor Louis Walsh and fellow hopeful Martin Bashir at the Pride of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday.

The former Ex On The Beach star, 27, looked elegant in a black tulle gown with colourful floral gown as she embraced Martin, 56 and Louis, 67.

X Factor: Celebrity: Megan McKenna was clearly in the mood for celebrating as she joined mentor Louis Walsh and fellow hopeful Martin Bashir at the Pride of Britain Awards at London's Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday

The stylish tiered gown featured ruffled tulle detail across the midsection, derriere and floor length skirt, making for a dramatic Gothic look on the red carpet.

Her platinum locks were styled in soft waves while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up.

Louis looked dapper in a navy suit and powder blue shirt while Martin was sharp in a slate grey pinstripe number and polka dot tie.

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

Hugs: Megan looked over the moon as she embraced her mentor Louis

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
